odd.head: Scope and Contents
odd.p: The Hegeman family papers, measuring .21 linear feet, document the daily lives, careers, property, financial concerns, and family matters of the Hegeman family of Brooklyn, 1809 to 1886. Included in the collection are certificates, correspondence, wills, receipts, bills of sale, property documents, printed material, and newspaper clippings. The collection is organized into five series: Series 1: Correspondence; Series 2: Certificates; Series 3: Receipts; Series 4: Property documents; and Series 5: Printed materials.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Materials
relatedmaterial.p: For more genealogical information pertaining to the Hegeman family, see the Henry Onderdonk papers (ARC.045). Brooklyn Historical Society (BHS) also holds:
1. Thomas Hegeman New Utrecht, New York Justice of the Peace papers (1973.127).

The Othmer Library at BHS holds the related title by Helen Miller: Old Brooklyn Families: Genealogies of the Hegeman, Holgersen, Joosten, Nagel, Polhemius, Rapalje, Remsen, Stryker, Vanderbilt, and Van Wyck families. Santa Barbara, Calif.: s.n., 1986. (Main Collection CS69 .O45 1986 / Non-circulating)

bioghist.head: Biographical note
bioghist.p: Rem, James, and John L. Hegeman were brothers who descended from early Dutch settlers who immigrated to New Amsterdam (now New York City). Rem Hegeman lived in the town of Flatbush, one of original six towns of Brooklyn. His brother, John L. Hegeman lived in Melville, Long Island, N.Y. during the 1880s.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains handwritten correspondence, dating from 1838 to 1845, addressed to or from Rem Hegeman. Included in the series is a letter from James Hegeman telling of the death of his wife and an infant child, as well as letters from William Hegeman.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains three certificates, 1809 to 1878. Included are two certificates of military appointment for Rem Hegeman, 1809 and 1815; and a certificate of administration for the estate of John Hegeman to Rem Hegeman, 1878.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains receipts, 1810 to 1884, and undated. Included are handwritten receipts, 1810 to 1842; tax receipts; receipts for bills and services; and funeral expense accounts and receipts.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains two documents including the will of John Hegeman, 1847; and a bill of sale for a market wagon, 1886.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains two volumes of The Daily Verse Expositor, No. 4 and 5, printed in 1832; and a news clipping from The Sun, January 4, 1879.
